title: Past 90 fix
message:
Past 90 fix

changed default sensitivity to be 0.5
Fixed bug where past 90 degrees the value would start going back down
Fixed ui so that it would also not start rotating backwards when past 90

title: Couple of bug fixes
message:
Couple of bug fixes

Added disconnect button so you can go back on iOS app
made possession an object so that i can access variables from other
scripts (makes closing the connection and resetting stuff easier)
Fixed random disconnect bug caused by auto connection time out when a
udp packet is dropped sometimes
Delay display no longer shows trailing decimal
Added more smoothing to decimal display
Made sensitivity slider only go to 0.2 instead of 0

title: Added permissions pop message for newer android devices to allow the app to use the camera
message:
Added permissions pop message for newer android devices to allow the app to use the camera
Changed package name, and all instances of the package name throughout the app

title: Updated Xcode, entire app broke, spent 4 days cleaning up apples mess
message:
Updated Xcode, entire app broke, spent 4 days cleaning up apples mess

Updated Xcode to the latest version, which required updating swift to
swift 3, which in turn broke the entire app.
Spent 4 days trying to fix all the problems swift 3 caused
Finally got motion data back up and working and got the app running
again
Fixed lots of ui elements so that they support all screen sizes
Added background to menu so it looks okay wen overlaying the hud on
smaller screens
Fixed hard coded local ip
Removed old connect button
Fixed bug with sensitivity slider

title: Added start up scree, fixed bugs, added icons
message:
Added start up scree, fixed bugs, added icons

Added beaming menu screenshot for start screen
Added label with instructions on how to connect
Added button to close start menu and show qr scanner
Adjusted menu button size
Adjusted menu items position
Cleaned up print statements
Added three different size icons for each required slot

title: qr scanner fixed, tacky bug fix for data recieving
message:
qr scanner fixed, tacky bug fix for data recieving

Fixed qr scanner video showing in wrong orientation, and fixed it also
not showing full screen properly

“fixed” problem with hard crash with error stating the data received is
too large. this fix involved adding a print statement… It makes no
sense at all but without that print statement it crashes when receiving
data every time. I tried lots of other things to fix it, its the only
thing that has worked

title: Finished menu logic, now can open/close, and settings save and load
message:
Finished menu logic, now can open/close, and settings save and load

Added logic to show/hide menu when menu button is clicked
Added saving and loading user settings, settings save automatically
when anything is changed, and load upon start up.
Made menu auto hide once successful connection happens

title: Menu options added and functioning!
message:
Menu options added and functioning!

Added sensitivity slider ui
Added unit switch ui
Hooked both of those up to the app so:
sensitivity slider adjusts how sensitive the steering is
unit switch adjusts all math and displays in the app so it will
correctly show mph or km/h
Removed “MPH” text from base hug images
Replaced that text with actual ui text in the app so it can be updated
based on your unit choice

title: Removed "MPH" text from all instances of the main hud image
message: Removed "MPH" text from all instances of the main hud image

title: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/BeamNG/remotecontrol
message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/BeamNG/remotecontrol

title: Fixed bug with lag display smoothing
message: Fixed bug with lag display smoothing

title: Added lag display to the app
message:
Added lag display to the app

Added support for figuring out the time taken to send and receive
packets, so you know how much delay there is in your input.

title: Lights info displays added and working!
message:
Lights info displays added and working!

Added lights off background image
Added functionality for getting lights info from data packet and
converting that to display which lights should be shown
Added all lights ui images to project (low and high beams, left and
right blinker)
Added code to display all ui in the app
Added functionality to show/hide lights correctly depending on their
state in BeamNG

title: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/BeamNG/remotecontrol
message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/BeamNG/remotecontrol

title: Fixed android menu showing up by default
message:
Fixed android menu showing up by default
Added lights dash background for ios

title: Now receiving data packets from BeamNG and updated visuals correctly!
message:
Now receiving data packets from BeamNG and updated visuals correctly!

Cleaned up some code
Improved packet sending to reverse bytes and populate the array all in
one shot instead of unpacking and repacking nsdata twice
Fixed listen socket problems, now successfully receives data from BeamNG
Fixed loads of bugs with display numbers. speed display, speedometer,
gear display, and rpms now all display correctly

title: Controlling BeamNG now works!
message:
Controlling BeamNG now works!

Finally fixed data packet! Its now converting floats into Their raw
bites, adding it to an NSData object, flipping the byte order within
that object to Big Endian and then successfully sending that data to
BeamNG.

Fixed bugs with controls (braking and gas were backwards, steering was
off by 45 degrees)

title: Packet Sending
message:
Packet Sending

Changed ump connection type so its able to successfully connect to
BeamNG now
Its correctly sending packets now, sending a byte array of 4 floats
correctly so BeamNG can accept it

title: Building and running!
message:
Building and running!

Several hours of research combined with a couple small code changes
means the app is now able to build and run on an iOS device, and its
able to send the initial connection correctly, as well as receive the
hello packet back. Seams to be failing somewhere when actually sending
the data packet

title: Fixed sensitivty variable defaulting to 0 so you couldnt steer
message:
Fixed sensitivty variable defaulting to 0 so you couldnt steer
Added saving functionality to the app, so any options you set can now be saved and loaded between play sessions and no longer reset when closing/reloading the app
Removed "MPH" text from the speedometer texture in all instances
Added actual text to replace it, made it change between "mph" and "km/h" depending on what you have selected

title: Hide options menu by default
message: Hide options menu by default

title: Added menu icon
message:
Added menu icon
Added menu items to app ui (menu toggle button, switch for selecting between khm and mph, and slider for sensitivity adjustment)
Added mph/kmh option functionality support and made the speedo display the one chosen with the switch ui
Added sensitivity support so you can adjust the steering sensitivity with the slider in the menu
Added basic menu toggle functionality to hide/show the options
Fixed speed bar displaying incorrect speed

title: Removed location permission since its not needed
message:
Removed location permission since its not needed
Adjusted math to correctly display mph instead of kmh
adjusted position of the lag display to something more appropriate

title: Added support for figuring the connection delay between the app and the game.…
message: Added support for figuring the connection delay between the app and the game. Also fixed the byte int offset table being incorrect

title: Fixed speed and rpm so they actually read the exact correct values
message:
Fixed speed and rpm so they actually read the exact correct values
looked into why lights on display is not working
